definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately

sentences.english: At on the market, mimicry with shine on to move the west the phenomenon of the building is always inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 在市場上，模仿與照搬西方建築的現象始終如影隨形。

sentences.english: Commercial, copying have been frequent failure of the products in the Chinese example.
sentences.chinese: 商業上，屢見照搬的產品在中國失敗的例子。

sentences.english: But Tien said his commune can’t copy them.
sentences.chinese: 可阿德說自己的縣沒辦法照搬他們的模式。

sentences.english: Never copy foreign things blindly or mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 不要盲目地或機械地照搬外國的東西。

sentences.english: Copy the spirit of the original not do it verbatim.
sentences.chinese: 要學原文的神，切不可原封不動照搬。

sentences.english: Never copy foreign things blindly or mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 決不要盲目地機械地照搬洋東西。

sentences.english: Isn't it plagiarism if copy word by word?
sentences.chinese: 若逐詞照搬，豈不等於抄襲別人的譯文？

sentences.english: Or, more specifically, about whether to copy it.
sentences.chinese: 或者，更具體地說，重新思考是否要照搬。

sentences.english: Asexuals , on the other hand, are genetically identical to their parent — they are clones.
sentences.chinese: 而無性繁殖就是全盤照搬父母的基因，即克隆。

sentences.english: After that, a lot of Latin American literature merely aped European models.
sentences.chinese: 從那時起，拉丁美洲的文學不過是照搬歐洲模式。

sentences.english: Some of the opposition party's policies have been appropriated by the government.
sentences.chinese: 反對黨的一些政策已被政府照搬照用。

sentences.english: In those early days of opening and reform, the three-glass place setting seemed to be straight from central casting in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在改革開放初期，擺三隻杯子似乎是照搬北京的模式。

sentences.english: Never copy foreign thing blindly or mechanically.
sentences.chinese: 決不要盲目地機械地照搬洋東西。

sentences.english: Mechanical copying of anything foreign would be disastrous.
sentences.chinese: 機械地照搬外國的東西要喫大虧的。

definition: the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
lit. to draw a dipper with a gourd as a model (idiom)/fig. to copy slavishly
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
pinyin: hua4 hu3 bu4 cheng2 fan3 lei4 quan3

definition: to copy a set pattern mechanically/to crib
lit. drawing a tiger using a cat as a model (idiom); fig. to follow a model and get things more or less right but without capturing the spirit of the subject/uninspired imitation
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
virtually the same/differing only on small points
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
